byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting, and Jack Begg contributed research.

abstract: Political opposition to resettling Syrian refugees in United States, as well as other recent examples of anti-refugee sentiment, has raised difficult feelings for many Japanese-Americans; atmosphere of fear and discrimination recalls internment during WWII, one of most shameful episodes in American history.
lead_paragraph: The dark memories of seven decades ago have bubbled to the surface in recent weeks for many people who were sent to Japanese internment camps.

headline.main: Resistance to Syrian Refugees Calls to Mind Painful Past for Japanese-Americans
headline.print_headline: Resistance to Syrian Refugees Calls to Mind Painful Past for Japanese-Americans

snippet: The dark memories of seven decades ago have bubbled to the surface in recent weeks for many people who were sent to Japanese internment camps.
